items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty indicates a weak start; US, Asian markets fall
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: US stock indexes closed lower on Wednesday as chip stocks tumbled and investors awaited a host of corporate earnings. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 91.51 points, or 0.22%, to 42,141.54, the S&P 500 lost 19.25 points, or 0.33%, to 5,813.67 and the Nasdaq Composite lost 104.82 points, or 0.56%, to 18,607.93.

items.title: First Tick: Top 10 global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The GIFT Nifty is indicating a weak start for the day.

items.title: ACME Solar Holdings sets price band of Rs 275-289 a share for IPO
items.description: The anchor book will be launched on November 5, while the maiden public issue will close on November 8

items.title: Stock Radar: Larsen & Toubro, Biocon, Tata Power, DCM Shriram, Godavari Biorefineries, Yatharth Hospital in focus on Thursday
items.description: Stocks like IRB Infrastructure Developers, Automotive Axles, Wipro, Adani Power, Allcargo Gati, and Torrent Pharmaceuticals will also be in focus on October 31.

items.title: Sirca Paints| Growth at reasonable price| Is it the right time to invest in this stock?
items.description: Sirca Paints is a leading manufacturer of premium Italian wood coating products in India under the brands “Sirca” and “Unico”. Company's last quarterly result was soft due to labor shortages on account of the election and heatwaves in North India. This impacted real estate activities. Margins also dipped due to elevated logistics cost. However, with a focus on high-value products, acquisition of the "Welcome brand" to expand into paint thinners and continued strength in Unico (Wood coating), wall paints, and high-end decorative paints, future looks promising.

items.title: Brokerage Radar: Analysts back Larsen & Toubro, CLSA issues 'Hold' on Dabur
items.description: Check out the latest brokerage calls and analyst comments on the stocks in action today. Our coverage includes Larsen & Toubro, Cipla, Dabur India and more.

items.title: Brokerages give a thumbs up to L&T's surprise Q2 results, predict up to 22% stock upside
items.description: CLSA rated L&T as 'outperform' and set the highest target price of Rs 4,151 per share

items.title: Nifty, Sensex extend fall on weak global cues, pharma stocks bounce back; VIX up 4%
items.description: The sentiment around the market could likely remain negative until the foreign institutional investors curtail their selling.

items.title: Agri Picks Report October 31, 2024: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit, Farmers in Rajasthan have sown rabi crops over 2.58 million hectares as of Monday, down slightly by 1.4% on year from 2.61 million hectares sown in the same period last year, according to the report released by the state's agriculture department.

items.title: Dabur: A bigger rural footprint, a wider product basket key growth levers
items.description: Urban demand has bottomed out and expected to pick up once food inflation stabilises

items.title: Cipla stock soars 10% after USFDA tags Goa unit as VAI, opens door for Abraxane drug launch
items.description: The long haul of regulatory issues at Cipla's Goa manufacturing site had resulted in multiple delays for Abraxane's anticipated launch, prompting analysts to project it as a potential opportunity only in FY27.

items.title: DII buying hits a record Rs 1 lakh crore in October even as FIIs offload equities worth nearly $11 bn
items.description: DII investments in 2024 have been around Rs 4.41 lakh crore with two more months to go

items.title: GR Infraprojects rises 6% on securing Rs 1,885 crore road project
items.description: The project involves the construction of an access-controlled ring road in Pune, covering 9.34 kilometers from Kalyan/Rathwade village to Shivare/Kusgaon village.

items.title: Indian IPOs set new record; Raise Rs 1.22 lakh crore in 2024
items.description: The cumulative amount of funds raised through IPOs has reached over Rs 1.22 lakh crore so far in 2024, surpassing the previous record of Rs 1.18 lakh crore in 2021. Around 70 percent of this record amount has been raised since August.

items.title: Short Call: Broader market needs to fall more before becoming attractive; Dabur, Five-Star, Skipper in focus
items.description: "A market downturn doesn’t bother us. It is an opportunity to increase our ownership of great companies with great management at good prices," — Warren Buffett

items.title: Biocon shares slump 5.5% as net profit takes a dive in Q2
items.description: While Biocon reported a dismal earnings show for Q2, the management as well as brokerage remain hopeful for a better second half of FY25. Key triggers for the stock include clarity over USFDA compliance of Biocon's Malaysia and Bengaluru facilities.

items.title: Wipro, Biocon , IRB Infrastructure Developers , Larsen & Toubro, Tata Power Company  In Focus
items.description:
L&T Q2 profit beats estimates, up 5% YoY at Rs 3,395 crore, but operating margin weak. 
Tata Power Q2 profit rises 6% YoY to Rs 926.5 crore but revenue falls 0.3%. Biocon Q2 earnings miss estimates. Profit tanks 84% YoY to Rs 27 crore on lower operating margin, other income.  IRB Infrastructure Developers Q2 profit grows 4.3% YoY to Rs 100 crore on healthy operating margin, high other income. Revenue down 9%. Wipro collaborates with Microsoft and SAP to accelerate RISE with SAP migration at near zero cost

items.title: Larsen & Toubro: Better recovery in H2 likely, aided by higher order inflows
items.description: A general slowdown in the construction and engineering segment in H1 hit the company. However, higher capex and likely availability of workers and other resources are expected to make H2 stronger.

items.title: Mastek shares rise 2% as Macquarie maintains 'outperform', sees 17% upside
items.description: Macquarie said that the company's recent acquisitions delivered positive results.

items.title: IRB Infra stock drops 4% on subdued Q2 earnings show
items.description: As of the September quarter, IRB Infra's order book reached Rs 3.26 lakh crore, with the Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) segment contributing 12.3 percent and Operations and Maintenance (O&M) contributing 87.7 percent.

items.title: Nifty IT index tumbles nearly 3% after US tech earnings disappoint
items.description: Meta Platforms announced weaker-than-expected user numbers in its third-quarter results, while Microsoft's revenue growth guidance fell short of expectations.

items.title: Mid-day Mood | Nifty, Sensex plunge further as IT stocks bleed
items.description: Nifty Pharma and Healthcare managed to hold firm after rising over a percent in the afternoon.

items.title: Accumulate Supreme Industries; target of Rs 4895: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services recommended accumulate rating on Supreme Industries with a target price of Rs 4895 in its research report dated October 30, 2024.

items.title: Ashoka Buildcon shares rise with ACL stake acquisition
items.description: In conjunction, Viva Highways, a subsidiary of Ashoka Buildcon, will acquire a 26 percent equity stake in Jaora Nayagaon Toll Road Company for Rs 150 crore.

items.title: Prudent Corporate jumps 14%, hits new lifetime high on healthy Q2FY25 results
items.description: In Q2FY25, the company’s operating revenue surged by 51 percent year-on-year to Rs 286.1 crore
